titleInfo.title: Letter from Lord Northbrook, Government House, Simla to Colonel Lewis Pelly

mods.abstract: Letter regarding Lord Northbrook's forthcoming visit to Agra which has been postponed by a week and his request that any Chiefs coming to see him there be put to as little expense as possible.The letter also discusses the definition of a Native as laid down in Act of Parliament and which was agreed to by the Secretary of State, meaning that Eurasians are classed as Natives of India under the agreed definition.The letter concludes by thanking Pelly for his opinions on the vacancy at Harrowte [Haraoti]; Pelly's response to the Beawar address; priorities for new Railways in the following year; and difficult questions in relation to the Thuggee department (department responsible for dealing with highway robbery and banditry).
